713549f-b.text:
(1)
West 51st Street, st, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Sixth Ave. (Elevated Line), as seen across clearance for Radio City and from 68 West 48th Street. Also shown (foreground) is 49th and 50th Streets. (70 story R.C.A. Building site) with its 3-story corner buildings.
October 21, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Another view, but not showing West 49th Street. The excavation shown on the east side of Sixth Ave., and between 50th and 51st Streets, will be the site of the 31-story R.K.O. Building and the 8-story International Music Hall.
October 21, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A similar angle and showing a more extensive view no:thward.
October 21, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

713546f-b.text:
West 5lst Street, south side, east from Sixth Ave. Shown thru the steel lattice work of a unit of Radio City, at the S.W. corner od Fifth Ave., is St. Patrick's Cathedral, R.C. Other prominent structures are respectively from left to right, the General Electric Building, the Waldorf-Astoria Hotel and No. 444 Madison Ave. On the extrene
right appears a portion of Sak's Dept. Store.
October 22, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
The same, slightly eastward.
October 22, 1932.
P. L. SPerr.

713552f-a.text:
West 5lst Street, east from (No. 127) a point between Seventh and Sirth Aves., showing automobile parking spaces on both sides of the street, with a portion of the Sixth Ave. Elevated Line on Sixth Ave. On the south side of the street (right), appears the lower floors of the 31-story R.N.0. Building, at the S.E. corner of Sixth Ave., and in the background, the 50-story deneral Electric Building, at the S.W. corner of Lexington Ave.
March 30, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

709570f-a.text:
(1)
Sixth Ave., west side, north from (No. 1287), but not including West 51st Street. No. 1287 being a portion of building at the N.W. corner of 51st Street. Shown under demolition are Nos. 1289 to 1297 (at, adjoining and south of the S.W. corner of West 52nd Street). The Sixth Ave. Elevated Line, as shown turns westward on 53rd Street.
March 1E, 1937.
L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, slightly later. Note further demolition of buildings at
the S.W. corner of 52nd Street.
March 30, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

713550f-a.text:
West 51st Street, south side, at Sixth Ave. Shown across demolition is Sixth Ave., west side, between West 50th and 51st Streets.
June 28, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

713554f.text:
West 5lst Street, south side, west from a point slightly west of Sixth, to Seventh Aves., showing a further portion of the New York Railroad carbarn under demolition. West of same appears the Roxy Theatre and the Hotel Manger (Hotel Taft, 1938), both located upon what in 1925 was occupied by a similar structure to that shown under destruction. At that date the entire block appears as a carbarn. In 1938, the now being cleared site, will remain vacant. This set consists of a negative and a positive.
December 12, 1927.
F. M. 1emarest.
Oift of Albert A. Volk Co.
